descript.abstract: NPL site point locations for the US EPA Region 9. NPL (National Priorities List) sites are hazardous waste sites that are eligible for extensive long-term cleanup under the Superfund program. Eligibility is determined by a scoring method called Hazard Ranking System. Sites with high scores are listed on the NPL. The majority of the locations are derived from polygon centroids of digitized site boundaries. The remaining locations were generated from address geocoding and digitizing. Area covered by this dataset include Arizona, California, Nevada, Hawaii, Guam, American Samoa, Northern Marianas and Trust Territories. Attributes include NPL status codes, NPL industry type codes and environmental indicators. Related table, NPL_Contaminants contains information about contaminated media types and chemicals. This is a one-to-many relationship and can be related to the feature class using the CERCLIS_ID field.
descript.purpose: This data is specifically designed for use with ArcGIS and related extensions. This data is useful for general maps and web mapping applications.
descript.supplinf: The NPL data is current to May 08, 2014

idinfo.useconst: Each point is a general representation of a facility or a contaminated area. This dataset is best used for small scale general mapping. It is not suitable for site specific or detailed mapping or analysis.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.1850

dataqual.logic: Points represent polygons centroids. Locations were verified using NPL polygons, county boundaries, and other features.

horizpa.horizpar: Positional accuracy for the data set varies for individual features but falls within the available NPL polygon. The R9_NPL_MAD table contains information about horizontal locational accuracy.

procstep.procdesc: Used the EME to move metadata into SDE.
Added Blue Ledge Mine, New Idria Mine, Southern Industrial Avenue Area and Jervis Webb. Updated NPL status and other attributes.
Updated NPL status, construction status, EIS human exposure and URL link to additional information

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

enttyp.enttypd: National Priorities List Superfund sites within Region 9

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Unique identifier for each NPL site

overview.eaover:
CERCLIS_ID - EPA CERCLIS ID number. Unique ID for each facility. SITE_NAME - Name of facility STREET - Address of facility CITY - City facility is located in COUNTY - County facility is located in STATE - State facility is located in ZIPCODE - Zipcode of facility
SOURCE - Source of facility location. OERR-POLYS - Facility boundary polygons digitized by the OERR-EMSL-EPIC group from multiple sources. Point is centroid of polygon. CERCLIS - Data extracted from the CERCLIS database and address matched by GDT Services. MANUAL - Manually digitized using primarily TIGER data.
CONG_DIST - Primary congressional district of facility.
STATUS - NPL status code. This is the status of a site in relation to the National Priorities List. The following are descriptions of status codes: F - Currently on the Final NPL P - Proposed for the NPL R - Removed from the Proposed NPL S - Pre-proposal site A - Site is part of an NPL site D - Deleted from the Final NPL C - Final NPL, Construction completed W - Withdrawn from NPL list
SITE_STATUS(Construction) - NPL production category. Investigation/Design Early Action Construction Underway Construction Completed Deleted
FEDFAC - Federal Facility N - is not a Federal Facility F - is a Federal Facility
RESC_CAT_CODE & DESCRIPTION - Codes and descriptions for the primary type of facility and/or contamination OT - Other MP - Manufacturing/Processing/Maintenance MI - Mining MT - Multiple RE - Recycling WM - waste Management
RSSC_SUB_CAT_CODE & DESCRIPTION - Codes and descriptions for the sub-category type of facility and/or contamination. AG - Agriculture BS - Batteries/Scrap CA - Chemicals CL - Co-disposal/landfills DT - Drums/Tanks EE - Electrical Equipment GP - Groundwater Plume IF - Industrial Waste MD - Mine Tailings ME - Metals MO - Military/Ordnance MT - Multiple NM - Non-metals OP - Ordnance Production OR - Oil/Gas Production OT - Other PR - Plastics/Rubber PS - Production Storage RD - Research/Development TP - Transportation TS - Trucks/Ships/Airplanes WO - Waste/Used Oil WP - Lumber/Wood Products
SITE_STATUS_CODE F - NPL Status = F - on the Final, construction not completed D - NPL Status = D - Deleted C - NPL Status = F on the Final and construction is completed P - NPL Status = P - proposed
HUMAN_HEALTH This is for the environmental indicators. Under current conditions at this site, potential or actual human exposures are under control. YES = Under Control NO = Not Under Control Insufficient Data = Not enough information to conclude human safety
RELATED TABLE NPL_CONTAMINANTS - Related by EPA_ID To the CERLICS_ID in the feature class. This is a one-to-many relate. Contamination can occur in more than one media type and include more than one chemical. The source for this data is the CERCLIS database.
EPA_ID = CERCLIS_ID - unique identifier for each site. SITE_NAME = Name of NPL site CAS_NO = Unique identifier for each chemical CHEM_NAME = Name of chemical
CONTAM_MEDIA = Media type that contamination occurs in. Air Buildings/Structures Debris Groundwater Leachate Liquid Waste Other Sediment Soil Solid Waste Surface Water
CONTAM_GROUP = Groups for chemical types Base Neutral Acids Dioxins/dibenzofurans Inorganics Metals Nitroaromatics Not Provided Oil & Grease Organics PAH (Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbons) PCBs Pesticides Petroleum Hydrocarbon Radioactive VOC (Volatile Organics)

distinfo.distliab: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the Environmental Protection Agency, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. It is strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data to evaluate data set limitations, restrictions or intended use. The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.3.3600
